name: Hotel Zoo Berlin

reviews.text: I have just returned froma trip to Berlin, where I stayed at the Hotel Zoo. It is in a fantastic location, close to the s-bahn station and in a shopping area, where there are plenty of places to eat.
reviews.title: Would stay here again

reviews.text: The room was large and very spacious, as we were on the 6th floor we even had a small balcony. There was plenty of wardrobe space and a large bathroom, which had a shower over the bath.
reviews.title: Good Location

reviews.text: Wonderful property with best possible location, whatever is your purpose for visiting Berlin.
reviews.title: Wonderful!

reviews.text: During a recent stay at the Hotel Zoo in Berlin, we had excellent experiences. Our room was ready early, which is rare but much appreciated after 24 hours of travel. The room, a junior suite, was spacious and had a wonderful view of Ku'domme, the major street. It provided nice views but little to no noise pollution. Breakfast, which was included in our rate, was excellent! The staff was wonderful and very responsive. I would recommend this hotel highly.
reviews.title: Excellent location!

reviews.text: The hotel is in a good location on the main shopping street and very near to the zoo and u-bahn, s-bahn station. The area was busy and felt safe at night.
reviews.title: Good location and not bad for the price

reviews.text: The hotel entrance was a lot nicer than the rooms but the one we had was large and although wasn't very modern and I wouldn't call it 4 star it was fine considering the price. Breakfast was good too, lots too choose from.
reviews.title: Do not stay there

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed August 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Was booked into this hotel based on the photos on the website - which are very misleading. The rooms are distintly 50s style and extremely worn. There were dirty patches all over the carpet and the train line which goes by the hotel will keep you awake all night.
reviews.title: Dissapointed! Not what you expect for a 4 star!

reviews.text: Hotel AM ZOO is conveniently located on the famous Kurfürstendamm, just a short walk from Bahnhof Zoo station, the U-Bahn and bus station. My main gripe with this hotel was that I booked a double bed, but was only supplied with a single. When I discovered this too late to fix it, they at least threw in the buffet breakfast gratis. Otherwise, room was good, and buffet breakfast was excellent with good variety and differnt choices each day. No free internet point to check emails.
reviews.title: Great location for AM Zoo

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed December 2006, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: My Girlfieind and I stayed at the Hotel Zoo for 3 nights in Mid December and found it exceeded our expectations.
reviews.title: Great for a city break (and panda spotting!)

likes.liked: — Location, and quiet and calm atmosphere.

reviews.text: Our room was large and spacious, and had a particularly big bed, although seconding previous reviews the television is a little dated, and the only english channel is CNN!
reviews.title: Really great hotel

likes.liked: — Location and high standards of the hotel

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed October 2006, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The room was immaculately clean and maid service was daily, we asked for 2 extra pillows on arrival and came back to find them shortly after, with a complimentary basket of fruit and biscuits which was very nice.
reviews.title: Great Location, yummy breakfast - probably due for a bit of facelit

likes.disliked: — After the awesome hotel we had in Cologne for a bit less, realised the decor was a bit tired.

reviews.text: Staff were always friendly and spoke good english.
reviews.title: Try some place else, poor service

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed January 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Good location.
reviews.title: Professional if nothing else

reviews.text: Very smart lobby, perhaps harking back to greater days. Inside the building, just a normal hotel. Four star? Slightly dubious on that one. Service was professional (English speaking staff) but at no point friendly. We were given a room different to that on our receipt but seemed similar from the floor schematic.
reviews.title: Great little hotel!

reviews.text: We were on the inside of a square courtyard so noise was quite bad. Think this was more porters etc. than guests. No bath and my girlfriend was burnt by the shower changing temperature all by itself. Other than that the bathroom was clean.
reviews.title: Good Location - Value for Money

likes.disliked: — lack of internet access in the rooms

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed December 2007, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The beds were quite small by British standards, 2 domestic size singles in a bizarre L-shaped configuration (had twice requested a double pre-arrival and the hotel public areas certainly never seemed busy). Free space in the room was dominated by an unfortunately placed fixed desk.
reviews.title: Excellent location, very good value for money

reviews.text: Room appeared slightly dated but had obviously had some (limited) modernisation in the past few years.
reviews.title: Just fine and dandy!

likes.disliked: — Can't say I didn't like anything!

reviews.text: Hotel Zoo is located in a great part of downtown Berlin. You are close to shops, restaurants, the main shopping areas, bus tours, etc. It is an ideal hotel to book if you want to explore downtown Berlin.
reviews.title: Great Location - Decent Price

likes.liked: — Clean. Modern. Great value for the money.

reviews.title: Hotel Zoo, Berlin. Excellent hotel.
reviews.text: The hotel itself was being renovated when I was there. The rooms did not have air conditioning which made the stay a bit hot. There are some train tracks that run in front of it and if you're facing them, it can keep you up at night.

reviews.title: Far better than the other reviews led us to expect!
reviews.text: All in all, it is a great place to stay and the prices are far better than any other hotel that I checked out in Berlin. For the sake of conveniance, it is well worth it.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed June 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We have just returned from Berlin where we stayed in this hotel for five nights. We found it to be an excellent hotel. The staff were business like and on the face of it a little aloof but when you spoke to them they were very helpful. The housekeeping was excellent, in particular one English person who was very friendly. He cleaned the room, folded clothes, aired the room and did things for us beyond what his normal job would have been.
reviews.title: Good Value Good Location

reviews.text: Breakfast was basic, but served in nice surroundings, the hotel was quiet and ideally situated. The room for three persons was large and airy. The bathroom small but well laid out with two wash basins, shower over half bath and toilet.
reviews.title: the rooms very deplorable 2 bed one behind the other bathroom for midget

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed May 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We stayed here for four nights in May 2008, and although it was adequate I'd struggle to recommend it to anyone over 25 years of age.
reviews.title: Good at what it does......

reviews.text: On the plus side the Hotel Zoo is ideally located within Berlin, being only minutes walk from the central bus station, a rail station & just seconds from the nearest 'underground' station. Because of this it makes a good base if you only need a crash-pad. The hotel couldn't be faulted on what it provided; the room we had was comfortable & very clean; the staff we friendly & helpful; the public areas were clean and the breakfast (although pricey at €11 per person per day) was of good quality, variety & quantity.
reviews.title: Excellent hotel

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed April 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: However..... What it lacked were the 'comforts' that a lot if people travelling in Western Europe have come to expect. We had no facilities to make hot drinks in our room; there was no room service on offer, so we couldn't even get a coffee if we wanted one; our mini-fridge wasn't working on our arrival & was still broken when we left 4 nights later. Also, the only toiletry on offer was a bottle of shower gel firmly fixed to the wall. We also failed to get anything other than local language (German) TV & radio on the small television provided in the room. Whilst this is partly a criticism of myself for not being more of a polyglot it is the only time whilst travelling on the European mainland that I've had a room without at least one English language channel.
reviews.title: Nice location, shame about the rooms

reviews.text: Overall I can't recommend Berlin as a destination highly enough, but would struggle to advise a stay at the Hotel Zoo, especially to anyone used to what are now regarded as the basics of European hotels.
reviews.title: Location Could Not Be Better

reviews.text: Although there were minor problems with housekeeping, the excellent staff took care of them immediately. They were efficient, friendly and helpful. The breakfasts were very good, the room comfortable, and the hotel well located.
reviews.title: Excellent hotel close to everything......

description: We are closed for renovations until the end of 2013. We are looking forward to welcome you to the NEW Hotel Zoo Berlin.
